Notes on Laminar Matroid

Posted on December 17, 2022
Tags: zzz

references:

https://cdn.vanderbilt.edu/vu-my/wp-content/uploads/sites/2392/2015/07/14141714/Tara-E-Fife.pdf

https://arxiv.org/abs/1606.08354

1 prove the exchange property

prove through induction on ∣A∣(use definition 1)

  • ∣A∣=1, this is obvious.
  • assume exchange property holds for ∣A∣≤k. Need to prove that for two independent set I1​,I2​, ∣I1​∣>∣I2​∣, ∃i∈I1​\I2​ s.t. ∀A,∣A∣=k+1,∣{I2​∪i}∩A∣≤c(A). Suppose the exchange property doesn’t hold for ∣A∣=k+1. For all i exists A∋i, ∣I2​∩A∣=c(A). Since I1​ is an independent set, ∣I1​∩A∣≤c(A) for those A, {I2​\I1​}∩A=∅, then for those A ∣A∩I1​∣≤∣A∩I2​∣. Thus for any i∈I1​\I2​, there is a set A s.t. ∣A∩{I2​\I1​}∣≥∣A∩{I1​\I2​}∣, and those A are disjoint since A∈A. Thus ∣I1​∣≤∣I2​∣. So exchange property holds for k+1
